Key Match Events: The White Sox scored 7 runs in an inning for the first time this season during their 7-0 win over the Angels.
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox drew 1,380,433 for the season, with an average of 17,928 per game.
The team had 120 defeats, tied with the 1962 Mets for the highest total in the Modern Era (since 1901).
There was some cheering for the White Sox to lose No. 121 during the first two games of the series, which didn’t sit well with Garrett Crochet.
Post-Match Reflections: Garrett Crochet said, 'I don’t love it. … That’s all I’m going to say,' regarding the fan support for the team to lose.
Grady Sizemore, interim manager, said, 'I’ve had the best relationship with these guys. They’ve kind of given me a new life and a new love for the game.'
Chris Getz, general manager, put Sizemore in consideration for the manager job during his media session.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scott Merkin has covered the White Sox for MLB.com since 2003.
